cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the central South Carolina coast, slowing as it nears land, then expected to drift north-northeast inland and emerge offshore of the North Carolina coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast near or just south of Charleston

weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet, South Carolina (includes Charleston area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) likely later tonight or early Sunday with gusts possibly higher in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above ground level possible around high tide, causing minor coastal flooding.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain totaling 1–3 inches expected beginning today and continuing through Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along area beaches which could hamper port small-craft operations.
